Title: 2008 Honda Civic
Description:
This is Amy (my daughter names all of our cars).  I bought Amy in 2010 when my oldest child got his license. She was first owned  by a couple that relied upon her for their nanny to drive the children around. 

All of my children learned to drive with Amy and when the oldest graduated college I gifted Amy to him.  Now I am selling her for him as he has finally opted for a new car.

Amy has 197K miles but runs like a top and still looks decent for her age and miles. She has lost her cool (A/C doesn't work) which just didn't bother my son who didn't bother to fix it. I'm not interested in fixing it either so she'll come without working A/C.  She does however have almost brand new tires and has always received timely maintenance since we've owned her. I think she'll go for a long while still. 

My son and the title are in Roanoke but he'll come down to complete a transfer within a day or two for the buyer.

Come see her and drive her.  I won't ride with you and I'll need a copy of a valid driver's license for you to take her out.

Cash or cashier's check required to purchase.

Title: 2008 Nissan Maxima
Description:
This car is so fun and luxurious to drive that I nicknamed it ‘The Limo’!  I bought it in June 2021 from my mom who was the sole owner and took extremely good care of it with regular maintenance and needed repairs. I invested over $2,000 in late 2021 & early 2022 in the significant repairs listed below (we have all maintenance and repair records going back to the purchase date in 2008). The heated seats and steering wheel warm up fast are my favorite feature during winter.

Current Mileage: 239K

Recent repairs/maintenance:
2019
-new break pads (4) @211K

2020
-new 60K tires @220K

2021
-intake manifold gasket replaced @226K
-valve cover gasket replaced @226K
-new rear break pads & rotors @231K
-new left rear wheel bearing hub assembly @231K
-new right front wheel bearing hub assembly @231K
-new power steering belt @231K
-new AC alternator belt @231K


2022
-new spark plugs (6) @235K
-intake plenum gasket set @235
-new ignition coils @235K

While the car is in excellent condition, it does have some minor old age cosmetic wounds/imperfections. The sun roof started having trouble closing so has been left in the closed position but still functions as a moon roof. (It’s possible that it could be repaired, but I haven’t had anyone investigate.)

I am sad to let ‘The Limo’ go, but I have recently purchased an AWD vehicle for my move north. Please feel free to contact me with any questions.

Title: 2006 Honda Odyssey EX-L-200K-Loaded-Mechanic's Special
Description:
Up for sale is our 2006 Honda Odyssey EX-L with 200k. This van is loaded including factory rear HVAC and entertainment. This vehicle has served our family well for the past six years. The relative that owns the vehicles health has gotten to a point where they are no longer driving consistently, and we have decided to sell it. All the options work including, air conditioning, heat, power sliding doors, etc. The vehicle has been owned in North Carolina since new, has extensive service records, and clean title and Carfax history. The van has been sitting for the last year and not driven much. 

****Outside of the damage to the rear bumper, and general wear associated with the age and mileage, the vehicle has started to not run after about 15 minutes of driving it.  We have had the van looked at by several shops and given different answers each time. The general consensus is the catalytic converters have failed and are clogged. The vehicle can be driven 10-15 minutes before it will no longer accelerate. We are selling it as is since we were unable to get a clear answer to have it fixed. 

****Please read the add completely and email with any questions. We will delete the add when sold***** Thanks!

Title: 2003 Chevrolet Trailblazer - please read whole description
Description:
Been my mother’s daily driver for over 20 years and she still loves it. 

The good:  Starts, moves, stops, all electronics and 4wd work as they should.

Transmission replaced roughly 50k miles ago. 

The bad:  serpentine belt blew while mom was on the interstate. She limped the car another 5 miles, turned it off and had it towed home when safe. During that 5 miles it overheated as one would expect, and when we checked the oil at home it’s low. 

Engine still turns over and will start, but seems low on power. Belt still needs to be replaced. Car will have to be towed. Great for someone to fix up or use for parts.

Description: Ultra-rare 2004 Volvo S60R AWD 6-speed with only 115000 Original miles. 0 to 62mph in 5.7 seconds, a maximum top speed of 155 mph, a curb weight of 3481 lbs., the S60 R AWD has a turbocharged Inline 5-cylinder engine. This engine produces a maximum power of 300 PS at 5500 rpm and a maximum torque of 295 lb. Ft at 1950 - 5250 rpm. The power is transmitted to the road by the all-wheel drive (AWD) with a 6 speed Manual gearbox. The Haldex all-wheel-drive system uses an electronically controlled hydraulic coupling. It seamlessly distributes torque for optimized acceleration and handling. Under steady state, 90% of the power goes to the front wheels. Under acceleration, or when entering a corner, more power moves to the rear wheels, up to a maximum of 70%. The all-wheel drive system is linked to Volvo’s Four-C active suspension, traction control front and rear, as well as Dynamic Stability Control. The driver can choose Comfort, Sport, or the almost-race-ready Advanced mode, with just the touch of a button. You can also all or partially reduce the stability control safety net if you want the S60 R’s pure handling experience. New Replica R Type Front Splitters. New Pro Tuning trunk lid R-Type wing spoiler included. Late model 235 / 40 on 18-inch rims at the front, and 235 / 40 on 18-inch rims at the rear with almost new BF-Goodrich G-Force Comp-2 AS Z-rated tires (cost $800). Double piston Brembo/Caliper brakes with new front cross/drilled rotors and pads. New L&R side tie rods and ball joint. LED aftermarket fog lights. No oil leaks good clutch drives great. Recent service with new filters new steering rack and power steering pump. New wind deflectors. New front wheel bearings. AC blows cold all power accessories work as does cruise control, sunroof, mirrors, windows. 200-Watt Pioneer CD player with USB port for phone connection Original Tan Leather S 60-R Owner's manual case and books included. New NC State Inspection. Asking $7995 Cash FIRM no offers and no financing Clean and Clear NC Title in hand. Contact Tony vehicle is located in Warrenton NC 27589.

Description: 2001 Honda Prelude Automatic 106000 original miles Horsepower 200hp at 7000 rpm/195hp at 6600 rpm, Torque 156 lbs at 5250 rpm. Vehicle has a new low mileage transmission. Very clean non smoker interior with unmarked cloth seats, carpets, and dash. Car has new front engine mount, height adjustable ECCPP coil overs shocks to front/rear with adjustable ride height: Full height adjusting structure can lower about 30-50 mm height. New VMS racing light weight crankshaft pulley. New timing belt and serpentine belt, new AC compressor, new blower motor and new right window regulator. New Alcantara steering wheel cover with yellow center stripe. Power sunroof/ windows/mirrors work. 200 Watt Pioneer CD/FM Radio USB player. New 17 inch Acura wheels with new Uniroyal Tiger Paw Touring A/S Front & Rear 235/45R17 TIRES (cost $800) with upgraded cross drilled/slotted rotors and red painted calipers. Type R badges. New wind deflectors. Mugen front spoiler and new Mugen side skirts with rear aprons plus a roof spoiler and a special front hood painted spoiler that reduces side mirror airflow/vortex. New Honda spec. Phoenix yellow paint. No undercarriage rust/damage/oil leaks or any kind of previous accident damage. No Check Engine/Airbag light issues. North Carolina Clean and Clear title in hand. Asking $7795 Cash FIRM No Trades or Financing. Contact Tony Vehicle is located in Warrenton NC 27589

Title: 2005 Dodge Dakota V8 Magnum EXT Cab
Description:
2005 Dodge Dakota Extended Cab, SLT, V8 Magnum, with 4X4, and tow package. Tires and spare are in great shape.  178,000 miles, give or take...  I still drive it to town from time to time.

This truck is in great shape. It has a few dings here and there. Engine, Transmission, and 4 wheel drive work perfectly. I recently took it to a shop and had oil, transmission fluid, and brake fluid all drained and replaced. Back seat has fold down jump seats for two passengers in the back.

There is only one problem... Something is slowly draining the battery. If you crank it every day you will have no problem. If you keep a trickle charger on it you will have no problem... But, if you let it sit for more than 3 days the battery will go dead and you will have to jump it off. Probably an easy fix, but I am not a mechanic. But it does have a brand new battery from NAPA with a no questions asked warranty. I also removed the aftermarket stereo from the dash trying to see if that was causing the battery drain. That didn't fix the problem, but I bought a brand new stereo, still in the box, and I'll give it to you with the truck. 

Clean NC Title in Hand. No wrecks that I am aware of... Good strong truck!

$6000 cash...  Thanks for looking!

Title: 2004 F150
Description:
2004 Ford F-150

5.4 triton V8, around 225k miles. Runs well.
Transmission only has 1st and 2nd gear. No reverse. 

Front end has been rebuilt in last 50k miles: control arms, tie rods, ball joints. Rear diff rebuilt in 2020. A ton of other stuff done, receipts are in glovebox. 

3 inch lift, 35 inch tires that are wearing down. 

Check engine light is on due to fuel tank pressure sensor. I have the sensor, but the trans went out before I put it in. 

Has some dents in it, but would make a great work truck. Even when the transmission went out, it still didn’t leave me stranded.

Please call or text. I will probably not see email.

Title: 2010 Hyundai Santa Fe
Description:
With the way things are right now this vehicle seems like a great deal, Its a 4 cylinder, AWD suv with 138k in good condition and only $5.4k. Anything else with these specs is a lot more.
This has been a great family car. We bought this in 2011 because we wanted an suv with AWD. We purchased from a dealer in Cary and have been happy ever since. We are contemplating keeping it for our daugther's first car so we are interested in serious buyers only and will not entertain any low offers. 
I have 16 records showing regular maintenance and a spreadsheet to keep track of all service records. Powertrain is in great shape and I have recently upgraded some suspension parts. This summer Atlantic Tire replaced some front suspension components (receipt available). 
The tire pressure monitoring system is currently broken and I decided not to replace it until I need new tires. The tires are in good shape and do not need to be replaced immediately. That is the only item that I know of that is not working. 
If interested buyer will need to complete a bill of sale and provide a certified check. License plate will be removed at time of purchase.

Wheels4Hope cars offered for sale have been evaluated in our garage using a 10-page checklist covering safety, operational, and mechanical items. Identified problems have been repaired. All Hybrid batteries are tested.

•	New Rear Window

•	New Timing Cover and Valve Cover Gaskets
•	New Air/Fuel Sensor

•	Oil Change and Filter

Wheels4Hope Cary has vehicles for sale Mondays – Thursdays from 9:00 AM to 2:00 PM . This and other vehicles can be seen and purchased then at Wheels4Hope, 411 E. Durham Rd., Cary, NC 27511. (919) 832-1941.

Can you imagine life without a car? How would you get to work, the grocery store, the doctor, and your childcare provider? When you buy this vehicle, you support Wheels4Hope so we can repair program cars to place them with individuals and families in need. Wheels4Hope is a faith-based, non-profit car donation organization that repairs donated cars and recycles them back into the local community. We do this to provide affordable, reliable transportation to economically vulnerable families referred to us by one of our Partners.

Description:

Title: 2007 Mazda 3 Hatchback PENDING
Description: MECHANIC'S SPECIAL: Brake fluid leak, apparently from front ABS pumps, several ounces a day. Otherwise, the vehicle is excellent, has remained a daily driver with fluid top-up There is a rattle in the rear trailing arm, not unusual in this model. Otherwise, it's VERY GOOD: new suspension, brakes, calipers, clutch, A/C, O2 sensor, catalytic converter, all within the last 18 months. Fun to drive, sporty, excellent acceleration, never any motor problems. SALVAGE title from a deer impact. Hood, one fender, and bumper replaced. No structural or component damage. $2750obo IF THE AD IS UP, IT'S STILL AVAILABLE, DON'T ASK, I WON'T REPLY. Used/tested pumps run about $200 each. Replacement is a messy job.

Title: 2007 Mazda 6 - Clean Title - Great Fuel Mileage - Recent Engine
Description:
Read the entire ad- Most common questions have been answered in the below ad- Thanks 😊 

2007 Mazda 6  4 cylinder (great on gas) with a recent rebuild engine with ALL paper work from local mechanic shop 4 months ago over cost me $2000+ for that.  New parts this year starter, new brakes front and back over $600 in those repairs. Mechanically runs great. Clean nc title in hand. Non smoker, tires have around half tread. Heat and air work.  

Has minor scuffs and scratches here and there as this is NOT a brand new car. no major dings or dents. Interior is pretty clean no rips in carpet or seats. It’s NOT a brand new car but runs great and is over all clean for the year . Head liner is slightly starting to sag a little. 


Has been used as my highway car for long work commutes no longer needed is only reason selling. Serious inquiries only!!! Clean nc title in hand $4000 if you don’t have cash in hand ready to come look at it do not contact me, If the ad is posted it’s available. Will only meet near Angier or Coats area Publicly, no funny business!

Title: 2004 Nissan Quest 3.5 SE
Description: Second owner, had the car since 2006. Leather interior in good condition. Odometer does not work but the car should be around 150k miles. It has barely been used in the last three years. AC and heat works. New power steering pump and fluid. No fluid leaks, the car runs but recently started to misfire, I am pretty sure that it's the spark plugs or ignition coils. You can get the parts on Amazon for ~$100 but it's difficult to change them, I was not able to do it myself. With TLC this car can run another 100k. Clean title in hand. E-mail me if you are interested.

Title: 06 Nissan Frontier King Cab Pickup - 4WD/RWD - V6 - Manual -234k miles
Description:
Selling a 2006 Nissan Frontier King Cab Pickup 2D 6ft.

This is a 6 speed manual transmission, 6 cylinders, 4 wheel drive (low and high) or 2 wheel drive (RWD), finished in silver metallic and black cloth interior. The truck is equipped with 4 almost new Goodyear Wrangler tires, it comes with 2 front rubber mats, 2 rear cloth mats, a tow hitch and an original radio.

The truck is using a little bit of oil - common on this model - and the catalytic converters will need to be replaced in order to pass an emission test - hence the "service engine soon" light on the dash. Other than that there is nothing wrong with this pickup, everything is in working order.

This Nissan Frontier is in a pretty good shape overall. The interior is in a very good condition with no rips at all in the seats. The exterior of the pickup is in a good condition, as you can see on the pictures, there are a couple of scratches on the body and some of the paint peeled away on the A pillars. The central piece of the front bumper is cracked but the truck will come with a new one that will need to be installed as well as a new plastic cover to fit under the passenger headlight.

VIN:  1N6AD06W76C463438
Mileage: 234200, really well kept.
4.0 Liter engine,  6 cylinders, Manual, RWD.
Comes with one key.

Loaded with:

A/C
Power steering
Tow hitch
Rubber mats
...

Prior to the sale, the front brakes have been replaced as well as the front calipers.

Asking $6750.

Feel free to contact with any question,


Thank you for looking!

Title: 2001 Dodge Durango 4x4 SLT
Description: 2001 Dodge Durango 4x4 SLT (4.7 liter) for sale by owner. Clean title, runs great, brand new tires, new radiator, fairly new battery, heads recently rebuild, new power steering pump, new rear door struts, new wipers, spare tire in excellent condition. Bought it 4-years ago as a daily driver, but bought a newer car and no longer use it. Had initially planned to restore it, so it has many new parts, but am moving out of state now and can't take it with me. It needs a new speed sensor, so the speedometer recently stopped working and the ABS/Brake light came on. It's a common problem, but I don't have time to fix it. Air conditioner works, but will need Freon before next summer. Third row seating, tow hitch, and roof luggage rack.

Title: 2008 Toyota 4Runner 2WD
Description:
2008 Toyota 4Runner 2WD with the 4liter v6 engine. Good/excellent condition with 156,000 well maintained miles. Galactic Gray Mica with tan cloth power seats for both driver and passenger.
This vehicle is in exceelnt mechanical shape with like new frame and like new engine bay. The only cosmetic minor issue is the clearcoat on the roof only has begun to fade.

the following has been completed: Michelin tires with 99%tread. New battery and serpentine belt with trans fluid and rear diff changed. The spark plugs have been changed along with the PCV valve and air filter. New wiper blades. 

This 4Runner drives as new and runs very smoothly. No leaks or shakes at 75-80MPH. It gets 19MPG in town and about 21-22 on the highway.

The paint with the exception of the roof is excellent with a few very minor dings but no dents.

I am only selling to get something my wife can drive as we are both retired and she cannot handle the 4Runner

I can send pics only to a valid email address.

This si a great vehicle and has many miles left. Has a sunroof and also the JBL sound system that may need a new sub but I am not sure.
Please contact via email only.

dave

Title: 2008 Acura TSX
Description:
Well maintained '08 Acura TSX with the rare 6-sp manual and tan interior.  It's bone stock, no modifications ever.  I've owned this car for 10 years, and have binders full of every service record from 38k miles, along with the Carfax.  Major Maintenance over the last 3 years includes:
- New Clutch (OEM)
- New Tires (Conti DWS)
- New Axles (OEM)
- New Front Brake Pads/Rotors (OEM)
- New A/C Condenser (OEM)
- Fluid Exchanges (PS, Coolant, Brakes)

Other Positives:
- NOT a salvage or rebuilt title, clean!
- Clean leather seats, no rips or stains
- All electronics/sunroof work
- OEM Glass all around, no cracks
- No body rust

Negatives:
- Rear brakes due soon
- Small leak in exhaust
- Small A/C leak
- PS cooler leak (currently bypassed, hose is backordered from Acura)
- 1 broken sway bar link

Selling because we upgraded to a 3-row SUV to fit our growing family.  Can show any day but prefer to schedule around a weekend.  I'll accept a Cashier's Check or Paypal/Venmo (no fees).  No cash, no personal checks...  Open to offers after you see the car.  Can meet within a 10'ish mile radius of Cary, NC

Title: 2000 F250 Super Duty 72k miles
Description:
2000 Ford F250 Super Duty with a 5th wheel mount ball in the bed (72k-ish miles)
VIN: 1FTNX20S1YED46443


Bad things about this truck:
- The wipers don't work. I don't know why.
- The doors don't always unlock with the key fobs but the power lock buttons inside usually work.
- It's 22 years old.


Good things about this truck:
- Everything *but* the wipers are in good working order.
- 2 owners, both in the same family.
- Used for nothing but occasional horse trailer hauling for the first 20 years of its life, hence the low miles.
- Setup for towing with trailer and power connections at the rear.
- Body is in great condition with no rust.
- Rhino liner on the bed.


The truck works great but we don't need a truck in the suburbs. It needs to go haul heavy things somewhere for it to be happy. We're downsizing to a more family-sized car so we need to set the truck free, first. If you're able to give it a happy home, let us know.

Title: 2002 Camaro SS 35th Anniversary project car
Description:
2002 Chevrolet Camaro SS - 35th Anniversary. 

This is a great project car opportunity. The LS1 needed to be rebuilt at 232k miles and is currently pulled for that purpose. Could be rebuilt or replaced.

Other sizable work history: Jasper rear end rebuilt at 155k, clutch replaced at about 200k.

This has been a daily driver I’ve owned since 2012, regularly maintained, not raced or over worked.

Has the as-issued SLP modifications with 345hp listing, 6-speed manual with stock issued hurst shifter, forced air, aluminum exhaust, 10-spoke chrome wheels. Black exterior, black leather interior, traction control, T-tops. Some paint imperfections from age, front seat material needs replacing. Overall a very clean car and a fun daily drive.

Title: 2004 Toyota 4Runner Limited Sport Utility 4D
Description:
Sadly letting go of my 2004 Toyota 4 Runner Limited 4.0 liter/6 cyl. This car has been GOOD to me and I hope whoever takes it off my hands will love it as much as I have. Clean title and the only other owner was the family member I bought the car from.
In classic Toyota fashion, 4 Runners are known for their longevity and reliability. While she may have a lot of miles, I can assure you there is a ton of life left in this car. This car has seen me through life from San Diego to Durham and taken lots (and lots) of roadtrips without a single hiccup. Maintained and regularly serviced and all the records to prove it.
Full vehicle report available by request!

The Good:
- This is the limited edition with all the bells and whistles: heated leather seats, navigation, proper sound system, automatic sun roof, etc.
- All electronics in the truck work
- AC and heat both work swimmingly, cold is cold and hot is hot
- Tires are in excellent condition (replaced late 2020 with a 75,000 mile warranty)
- All spark plugs replaced last year
- New rotors (+ break pads) last year
- All mechanical fluids replaced within last year

The Bad:
- Passengers side front and rear window must be rolled up by controls on drivers side
- Tire pressure light is on, even though tire pressures are fine
- L blinker light needs replacing (blinking at super speed)
- Check engine light is on because catylyic converters need replacing. Light has been on since 2020 and I took it in for service to confirm that this was the only reason the light was on (have all service records from this). They cleaned out the cats and the check engine light stayed off for over a year, but it came back on a few months back. If you are registering it in an area that requires you to pass smog, they will need to be replaced in order to do so.
- Due for an oil change

The Ugly:
- Back R bumper has a cosmetic crack in it (see photos)
- Some oxidation of the paint
- Other usual signs of wear and tear (love)

Pretty firm on the price. Title in hand.

Text/reach out with additional questions at: 760- 5 zero 4 - 3 five five 4

Title: 2008 Toyota 4Runner 2WD
Description:
2008 Toyota 4Runner 2WD with the 4liter v6 engine. Good/excellent condition with 156,000 well maintained miles. Galactic Gray Mica with tan cloth power seats for both driver and passenger.
This vehicle is in exceelnt mechanical shape with like new frame and like new engine bay. The only cosmetic minor issue is the clearcoat on the roof only has begun to fade.

the following has been completed: Michelin tires with 99%tread. New battery and serpentine belt with trans fluid and rear diff changed. The spark plugs have been changed along with the PCV valve and air filter. New wiper blades. 

This 4Runner drives as new and runs very smoothly. No leaks or shakes at 75-80MPH. It gets 19MPG in town and about 21-22 on the highway.

The paint with the exception of the roof is excellent with a few very minor dings but no dents.

I am only selling to get something my wife can drive as we are both retired and she cannot handle the 4Runner

I can send pics only to a valid email address.

This si a great vehicle and has many miles left. Has a sunroof and also the JBL sound system that may need a new sub but I am not sure.
Please contact via email only.

dave

Title: Tahoe Chevrolet 2006
Description:
I have my 2006 Chevy Tahoe for sale.  I have owned it since 2014 and took great care of it.  It’s a Z71 top of the line for that make and model.  It is the last year they made this truck with real aluminum.   4x4 works well hitch ready.  It’s got only body damage in the front end due to a tractor trailer cutting me off in the rain.   This truck runs great the way it is now.  You don’t need a tow truck to haul.  Although I do suggest it get towed since the windshield is cracked.  motor and engine are strong and has great tires.  Like I said just front end damage.  I will consider reasonable offers.  I don’t need to sell it, if I come up with enough money soon I will get it fixed and keep it.  Mileage is about 187,000.  I have the clean title in hand.  I have the third row seats as well in pristine condition.

Title: 2006 Acura RSX Type-S
Description:
Fun sporty 6-speed manual has been beautifully maintained with clean title/carfax and great MPG! This car has all the deluxe features including:

* titanium gray leather seats and steering wheel
* original premium white pearl paint
* power moonroof
* power windows
* automatic climate control
* bose sound system
* new tires
* new OEM taillights (entire assembly replaced)

There is a tear in the front driver seat and the trunk power lock needs replacement (you can still lock/unlock the trunk manually from the inside). Otherwise this car has no other cosmetic or mechanical defects and runs like a dream.

Title: Jeep Wrangler JK 2007 2dr MUST SELL
Description:
For sale is a 2007 Jeep Wrangler X, 2-door.  The Jeep has 131,000 miles on it and has been used as a daily driver since we bought it last year.  We are selling the car and replacing it with a larger SUV.

Overall, the Jeep is in good condition.  The body has a few small dents/dings as well as a small spot of rust on the back.  There are some scratches on the plastic fenders as well.  The frame is solid and does not have rust or rot.  Mechanically, the car is great.  I have replaced many parts within the last year (about 10,000 miles); all listed below.  As far as I can tell, the car needs nothing.  I had the car coated with ceramic wax/sealant after I bought it.  I do have the original black shift knob if desired.  The Jeep has carpet and the back seat.  The Jeep has a solid front bumper with a winch.  The winch is fully functional and has a remote control.  I have never used it other than to test it out.  

The Jeep just passed the NC annual inspection and had the tires/wheels balanced. 

The radio is a Pioneer DMH-2660NEX with a microphone to allow hands-free calling.  It also supports Apple Car Play and Android Auto.  The speakers are all Rockford Fosgate and have been installed this year

The headlights have been replaced with J.W. Speaker LED headlights, which are amazing.  

The soft top was replaced with a Trektop® Glide™ Slantback by Bestop with the sunrider. The material is the premium black twill and has been cleaned and treated with Bestop's sealant. The glide feature makes the panels easily removable.  The Bestop storage bag is also included.  The bag holds all three panels in separate pouches to protect from scratches.

New parts, in addition to the few above:
Synthetic oil
Both differential fluids - Royal Purple synthetic
Transmission gear oil - Royal Purple Synthetic
Antifreeze
Spark plugs and wires
Battery
Brake fluid flush
Both exhaust manifolds, gaskets, and bolts
Intake manifold gaskets
PCV valve
EGR gaskets
All other gaskets/o-rings on the intake manifold
Front main/crank seal
Brake pads, rotors, and front calipers
Clutch slave cylinder
Front sway/stabilizer bar and bushings
Sway bar links
All four (4) shocks
Fuel pump
Gas tank skid plate
Oil pan gasket
Oxygen sensor
Rock Sliders (to serve as a step to enter the Jeep)

Title: 2001 Mustang GT supercharged
Description:
2001 Mustang GT w/manual transmission. Car is very
reliable, low miles on everything including body. Car drives
great, Convertable top, A/C
and Heat work perfect. Even the Mach 6 disc radio still
works! Wouldn't hesitate to drive it anywhere. Underbody is
very clean, no leaks from anywhere. Exterior is in good
shape (7.5 out of 10) but does have some dings and scratches
from 20 years of age and use. Interior is excellent (9 out of
10) and everything looks great.

Kenne bell intercooled 9psi supercharger setup, 75mm bbk
tb, 90mm mass air, JBA headers, catted X pipe and bassani
stainless exhaust. 18x9 / 18x10.5 Cobra reps, 4.10s w/carbon Is clutches, 3650 transmission, steeda
clutch quadrant with MGW adjustable shifter. Front
coilovers, Cobra brakes, subframe connectors, tubular rear
arms, new tires and the list goes on...

Originally a Canadian car so milage is in kilometers (ask for vin). 110k kilometers on
it which is equivalent to just over 68k miles. North Carolina title is
clean and in hand. Car also comes with some extras.

We are not a buy here/pay here lot. Please arrange financing if needed. 

Our dealership uses a No-Haggle pricing policy on all of our pre-owned vehicles. We price our vehicles very competitively in the market to give you an extremely fair price right up front. We do not negotiate on the price of the vehicle. Most of our cars are priced well below fair market value. We have taken many factors into consideration when pricing our inventory: exterior and interior condition, mileage, accident history, and remaining warranty just to name a few. Our cars are priced in the condition that you see them. As with any used vehicle, they have been driven on the road, parked in garages and parking lots and driven through all kinds of weather. Some wear and tear is normal. This may include some small scratches or door dings, interior wear, chips in the windshield etc. We have taken all of these into consideration and priced the vehicles accordingly. All vehicles must pass North Carolina State inspection. Cars come with one key unless otherwise noted or disclosed. Not all cars have second keys. Not all cars have owners manuals. We will be happy to price any parts or repairs that you may desire at our wholesale cost.

Title: 2005 Volvo S40 2.4L
Description:
If this listing is on Craigslist, this car is still available.

Serious inquiries only.  "What's the lowest you'll take?" and "Is that your best price?" will not receive a response.

Phone calls only after responding via email.


4 Door Sedan with black exterior and black, cloth interior.  5 speed manual transmission.

CARFAX report available.

Car drives and is inspected (Tennessee) through November 30, 2022.
Both front tires are new as of May 2022.  These are both Cooper Ultra tires.
Both back tires are new as of July 2022.  These are both Goodyear Reliant tires.
New AC Belt and Drive Belt as of June 2022.
Front lights, tail lights, and all interior lights work.
New battery as of December 2019 is under warranty through December 7, 2022
All seat belts work.
Good A/C and Heat
CD Player
Garmin GPS
Spare tire in trunk
Clean Title in hand


Needs:

The car drives, but the driver needs to press the clutch all the way to the floor in order to shift gears.  I would recommend replacing the clutch.  Parts Geek sells a new clutch kit for approximately $350 that matches the numbers (2.4L L5 B5244S4) for this car.

This car currently starts to ride "rough" around 50 mph.  I don't know what causes it to do this, so I usually just keep it under 50 mph.  One mechanic suggested the tires need to be realigned, but this is only a guess.  I'll look into getting this work done and I'll revise this listing if I'm able to resolve this issue.

The emergency brake doesn't really work.  I usually keep the car parked on a level surface.  If necessary, I put the car in 1st gear when it's parked.

The passenger right tail light housing / assembly should be replaced.  I think this costs less than $100 pre-owned on eBay.

The backseat right window doesn't roll down automatically and needs to be held in place (I've been using tape).  It's possible that the window simply needs to be reattached inside the door.

The upholstery, especially the interior ceiling of the car, probably needs to be replaced or repaired.

Title: 2008 MINI Cooper S Convertible – Sidewalk Edition
Description:
2008 MINI Cooper S Convertible – Sidewalk Edition – Automatic, Supercharged, Garage Kept.  94,040 miles.  Owned since Feb 2016.  Weekend car driven 30,000 miles over past 6-1/2 years.  Bought this for my wife as her 2nd car, and I performed a complete Preventive Maintenance service at 60,000 miles as I wanted to help insure she had zero concerns driving around the Triangle and occassional trips to Wilmington.  This is a quick summary of the work I performed: new rear wheel hubs, front and rear pads, rotors, fluid, new fuel pump assy with fuel filter, water pump, radiator fluid & hoses, heater hoses, power steering hoses & reservoir, oil change for the Eaton supercharger, new aluminum radiator overflow tank, new coil, spark plugs and wires.   All of this work performed in my shop to prevent future concerns.  Car is extremely reliable and ready for the next owner!

Synthetic 5W-30 oil and new filter replaced every 5-6,000 miles. 

Transmission fluid replaced Dec 2018, and cabin air filter in Dec 2019.  New front strut upper mounts in May 2020.  New run flat Hankook tires in July 2020.  Last oil change and front brake pads and pad wear sensor in August 2022.

New Kenwood AMFMCD stereo, Kenwood amp, and JL Audio component speakers replaced MINI stereo in June 2020.   17” Rota RB wheels with polished lips, Hankook performance tires, H&R lowering coil springs, and MILTEK stainless steel cat-back exhaust.   MINI sits approx 1” lower.  I have all the original wheels, coil springs, and exhaust system if the buyer should want these items.

MINI Cooper S has 6 speed Aisin automatic transmission, not the CVT auto in regular Coopers of the day.  Cold A/C, Cruise Control, PW, PDL, Power Top, optional chrome exterior package, optional gauge package, Astro Black Metallic over Malt Brown English leather.  Also has bi-xenon headlights with washers, fog lamps, rain sensing windshield wipers, heated front seats, and power folding side mirrors, The Sidewalk Edition was a two-year only production (2007 and 2008) and part of the very end of the R52 MINI Convertible – the first series of new MINIs.

Car has some small rock chips and minor scratches that one could expect on a 15 year-old car.

If the MINI is listed, it is still available.   And no, I do not need help marketing this car for sale.

LOW MILEAGE!! 29k mikes

Title: 2004 Saturn Vue AWD V6
Description:
Selling a good-condition 2004 Saturn Vue AWD 3.5L V6. Premium vehicle: leather interior, heated seats, power/keyless everything. This is a Saturn with a Honda drivetrain! Entire engine, transmission, transfer case, all Honda! In the early years after GM bought Saturn they tried moving all Saturn components over to their chassis and ran into problems, as a result they had to source their drivetrains from Honda. As a result, you're getting the components of a Honda Pilot for the price of a domestic SUV! I've owned the vehicle since 2015 and can attest to its Honda-esque reliability.

The great:
New front brakes: pads and rotors*
New front bearings*
New battery*
* All within the last month, 1,000 miles
Tires in great shape (see photos for tread depth) and just rotated
Aftermarket hitch and wiring harness - haven't towed much but it can haul fully lighted trailers

The good:
Interior 6/10 (some cracked leather, very few tears)
Exterior 6/10 (some scratches, few dents)
Bluetooth stereo
Mileage below-average, 180K. I'm still driving around, so this may go up a bit.
2 keys and remotes
20-25MPG, pretty good for a 3.5L V6 engine with AWD!

The bad:
Check engine codes P0420 (catalytic converter), P0300-0305 (misfires across all cylinders)
I've been getting the P0420 code for a few years, I've been getting inspection waivers annually because the cost to fix is >$200. The misfire codes are relatively new (within the last 3 months)

Asking $3,500 OBO.

Title: Ford F250 Super Duty = 5.4 Triton V8 = 4wd = New 35" Tires
Description:
Selling my 2000 Ford F-250 extended cab four wheel drive truck. This is gasser 5.4 liter V8 not a diesel as it may appear to be. Entire truck is plasti-dipped flat black as it was previously a landscaping truck. Truck comes with brand new 35 inch Ironman Mud Terrain tires (less than 500 miles since install), blacked out wheels, fender flares, LineX bedliner, tow package, aftermarket headunit and brand new black housing headlight assemblies. 

Truck has 238K on it. It runs very well with no known issues at this time. Ice cold ac. Transmission shifts smooth and four wheel drive works as it should. This truck has been in North Carolina since new but it is still 22 years old. Please take this into consideration. Not a perfect truck but in very good shape for the age and mileage. Contact me with questions or to setup a viewing. Thanks.

Title: 2007 Saturn Ion Redline Comp Pack
Description:
2007 Competition package Ion Redline.

Car runs good and is in overall decent shape. Interior and exterior are both pretty good with no major issue, just rough paint and some peels in the tint. The Fog light bezzle/insert on the passengers side is bust but repairable.

I put a GMPP clutch with LSJ TOB in about 600 miles ago as well as a stainless clutch cable, clutch master cylinder, and new clutch pedal. 
I also put FE5 end link in at the same time as the clutch
Has a new set of tires, nothing fancy, but they are new. 
No mechanical issues other than an exhaust leak at the header that I haven't had a chance to fix.

If it's posted, it's available. If you are interested in test driving, please know how to operate a manual. If you don't, that's fine but I'll be doing the driving.

Title: 2008 Toyota 4Runner 2WD
Description:
2008 Toyota 4Runner 2WD with the 4liter v6 engine. Good/excellent condition with 156,000 well maintained miles. Galactic Gray Mica with tan cloth power seats for both driver and passenger.
This vehicle is in exceelnt mechanical shape with like new frame and like new engine bay. The only cosmetic minor issue is the clearcoat on the roof only has begun to fade.

the following has been completed: Michelin tires with 99%tread. New battery and serpentine belt with trans fluid and rear diff changed. The spark plugs have been changed along with the PCV valve and air filter. New wiper blades. 

This 4Runner drives as new and runs very smoothly. No leaks or shakes at 75-80MPH. It gets 19MPG in town and about 21-22 on the highway.

The paint with the exception of the roof is excellent with a few very minor dings but no dents.

I am only selling to get something my wife can drive as we are both retired and she cannot handle the 4Runner

I can send pics only to a valid email address.

This si a great vehicle and has many miles left. Has a sunroof and also the JBL sound system that may need a new sub but I am not sure.
Please contact via email only.

dave

Title: 2005 Subaru WRX STI
Description:
Low mileage, completely stock. 
Clean title
Car is located in Cary. 
Does not run. I suspect it’s a timing issue. (No compression) It’s been garage kept and collecting dust. Interior is in excellent condition. Few minor scratches in paint and some sun fading on spoiler, as expected for a nearly 18 year old car. 

Comes with miscellaneous goodies: Cobb access port (installed), new left and right front lips from Subaru, new gates high performance timing belt and water pump with component kit, new timing belt tensioner and crank pulley tool.  Brand new custom weathertech car cover with cable and lock that fits the big spoiler.  

Hate to let her go but I’m military and stationed on west coast and don’t have the time to fix. feel free to ask me any questions about it or send me your offers

Sold as is. Can not deliver. 
Text or email first please.
